************************************************************** * $File : DocumentManager.cs * $Revision : 1.0.0.0 * $Date : 29-Oct-2004 * $Author : Aditya Babbar * $Comment : * $Source : ************************************************************** * Amendment --> 1.Date : 7 Feb 06 Desc : Replacing RMO_ACCESS use, and changing params of permission violation exception so it can be correctly called. Author : Sumit **************************************************************
Manages all operations related to documents, attachments and folders including add, update, copy, transfer and move.

DocumentManager.GetBaseSecurityIDForTable of Application layer gets Base Securiy ID for particular table(i.e. Admin Tracking tables).
An current base security ID. An current system table name. Structure of the output XML is: return Integer new base ID for a specified table or same ID in case of failure. A XML with user details.

member.name: M:Riskmaster.Application.DocumentManagement.DocumentManager.GetActualDocFilePath(System.String)
member.summary: For FileSystemStorage, the files are not necessarily stored in the folder specified in the DocPath when "Link Document" feature is used in RMWorld. The following three kinds of file path will handled: 1. begin with "\\computerName" or "DirveLetter:", use this as actual file path 2. Not null and not case 1, treat it as subfolder of DocPath 3. If null, use DocPath MITS 10062 Add support for Linked Documents from RMWorld
